orgSetting.name: EnableTDSEndpoint
orgSetting.description:
This, as it says, allows you to enable the CDS SQL TDS Endpoint, which allows you to use SQL Studio to query your live CDS environment. This is only recent, but is a great addition if you need more complexity in your queries.

Mark Carrington did a great set of posts on it's usage here

orgSetting.name: TrackAppointmentFromNonOrganizer
orgSetting.description: You can always track a meeting if it was sent from an external user and by default, you can track any appointment where the organiser is a D365 user. This setting prevents the user from tracking an appointment if it is not them organising it.

orgSetting.name: AutoCreateContactOnPromote
orgSetting.description:
By default, when a user sets regarding within the Outlook app, if any email address is in the To / CC / BCC etc that D365 does not know about, it creates it automatically.

Most of the time this is fine, but consider when your business process requires a lot more data fields to be populated in the contact, this default process will create a contact that hasn’t got what your business needs. Forcing the contact creation away from this automation may be required.

Users have an option under their personal settings which will mimic this settings, but this does it for everyone.

orgSetting.name: ChangeDoubleQuoteToSingleQuote
orgSetting.description: This setting will do as it says, convert double quotes to single, but is only relevant for the old Knowledgebase Articles in your system, superseded by Knowledge articles that now have an appropriate WYSIWYG editor, this becomes redundant.

orgSetting.name: DisableMapiCaching
orgSetting.description:
This was present to prevent server performance issues, typically seen with on-premise solutions, when results are retrieved from the cache of the server, rather than direct from the database.

It is unclear if still needed.

orgSetting.name: EnableActivitiesTimeLinePerfImprovement
orgSetting.description:
In 2019 Wave 2, October 2019, enhancements were made to the timeline, to improve the density of activities and allowing the user to filter by multiple types etc. Details here.

The new timeline can be seen below, which is toggled with EnableActivitiesFeatures described below. This setting toggles improvements to the performance of the new timeline, which may have an impact on your application..

Thought the official line is that this is disabled by default, in any new environment it seems to be enabled.

The new timeline can be seen below, toggled on and off by this setting.
